bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Brooklyn's Reformed Church on the Heights was a Protestant congregation named for its location in the neighborhood of Brooklyn Heights. Construction on the Church's building, located on the northwest side of Pierrepont Street at Monroe Place and designed in the Renaissance Revival style by noted church architect Minard Lafever, was completed in 1851. The Church was later demolished to make way for the Court House of the Appellate Division of the New York State Supreme Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains various records of the Reformed Church on the Heights dating from 1845 to 1852, including contracts, accounts, receipts, bills, and payrolls related to the construction of the Church's building, as well as deeds to the Church's land.
